Reason: The configuration option 'enableAntiAliasing' is performance-sensitive. Enabling anti-aliasing on scaled images directly impacts system performance by adding additional processing time and resource usage. The code snippet related to this configuration shows that if 'args.enableAntiAliasing' is true, the OP_ANTIALIAS filter is applied to the scaled image, which is a time-expensive operation. This operation can lead to notable performance variations at the system level, making the configuration performance-sensitive.
